original: Lindstam, Sten Ingemar, kyrkoherde, Markaryd, f. 23/8/08 i Norra Ljunga, Jönköp. 1., av kyrkoh. Filip L. o. Elsa Rydeman. G. 35 m. Oda Rasmussen (ordf. i Aarhus stud :kår 34-35). Barn: Hedvig f. 43, Christer 47. — Stud:ex. i Växjö 28, teol. kand. 33, prästv. f. Växjö stift 34. V. pastor i sv. Vic-toriaförsaml. i Berlin 35, kyrkoadj. i Bodafors 40-41, kommin. i Söraby 41-47, kyrkoh. i Markaryd sed. 47. Heni-värnspastor 43-46, krigsfångesekr. i världsförb. av KFUM i Engl. 45. Lunds ■stud:kårs ordf. 34-35. Oeblenschläger-Tegnérska resestip. i Danm. 36, delt. i ekum. världskonf. i Edinburgh 37 o. i Amsterdam 39. Hemv. ftj :plak. i silver 47.
translated: Lindstam, Sten Ingemar, parish priest, Markaryd, b. 23/8/08 in Norra Ljunga, Jönköping, 1st child of priest Filip L. and Elsa Rydeman. Married in 1935 to Oda Rasmussen (chairman of Aarhus Student Union 1934-1935). Children: Hedvig b. 1943, Christer b. 1947. - Graduated from Växjö secondary school in 1928, Bachelor of Theology in 1933, ordained as a priest in the Växjö Diocese in 1934. Assistant pastor at the Swedish Victoria Parish in Berlin in 1935, curate in Bodafors 1940-1941, vicar in Söraby 1941-1947, parish priest in Markaryd since 1947. Army chaplain during 1943-1946, POW secretary in the World Alliance of YMCA in England in 1945. Chairman of Lund Student Union in 1934-1935. Recipient of the Oeblenschläger-Tegnér travel scholarship in Denmark in 1936, participant in the Ecumenical World Conference in Edinburgh in 1937 and in Amsterdam in 1939. Received a home front plaque in silver in 1947.
